Package Controller

Class ChessPiece

java.lang.Object
Controller.ChessPiece
Direct Known Subclasses:
Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook
public abstract class ChessPiece extends Object

  • Constructor Details

    • ChessPiece

      public ChessPiece(int row, int col, PieceColor color)
      Sole constructor for this class. Creates the ChessPiece object and serves as the blueprint for all the chess pieces in the game.
      Parameters:
      row - the row the piece needs to be instantiated at
      col - the col the piece needs to be instantiated at
      color - the color of the chess piece

  • Method Details

    • getRow

      public int getRow()
      Gets the row of the current chess piece
      Returns:
      Returns the current row of the chess piece

    • setRow

      public void setRow(int row)
      Sets the current pieces row to the parameter
      Parameters:
      row - the row the chess piece needs to be set to

    • getCol

      public int getCol()
      Gets the column of the chess piece
      Returns:
      Returns the current col of the chess piece

    • setCol

      public void setCol(int col)
      Sets the current pieces col to the parameter
      Parameters:
      col - the col the chess piece needs to be set to

    • hasMoved

      public boolean hasMoved()
      Tracks to see if a chess piece has moved from its initial position. Primarily used for the Kings, Rooks, and Pawns for their special moves (Castling, en passant)
      Returns:
      returns true if the ChessPiece has moved, false otherwise

    • setMoved

      public void setMoved(boolean value)
      changes the ChessPiece's moved status
      Parameters:
      value - true if the piece has moved and false if the piece has not moved.

    • hasCastled

      public boolean hasCastled()
      checks to see if this piece has castled or not. Used for the Rook and King pieces.
      Returns:
      returns true if the King/Rook has castled, otherwise false

    • setCastle

      public void setCastle(boolean value)
      changes the King/Rook's castled status
      Parameters:
      value - true if the piece has castled, false otherwise.

    • getColor

      public PieceColor getColor()
      Gets the color of this chess piece
      Returns:
      Returns the color of the chess piece

    • isCaptured

      public boolean isCaptured()
      Checks to see if the piece is captured or not
      Returns:
      Returns if the piece is captured

    • setCaptured

      public void setCaptured(boolean status)
      sets the status of the piece as true or false
      Parameters:
      status - true means the piece is captured, false if it is not

    • isValidMove

      public abstract boolean isValidMove(int toRow, int toCol, ChessPiece[][] board)
      Checks if the piece is a valid move for the given type of chess piece. It checks all sorts of conditions unique to the piece such as castling, pawn promotion, etc.
      Parameters:
      toRow - the row the piece is being moved to
      toCol - the column the piece is being moved to
      board - the current board containing all the pieces on it
      Returns:
      Returns if the chosen position of the selected chess piece is legal

    • hasPiece

      public boolean hasPiece(int row, int col, ChessPiece[][] board)
      Checks to see if there is a piece at the given square on the board
      Parameters:
      row - the row the piece is being moved to
      col - the column the piece is being moved to
      board - the current board containing all the pieces on it
      Returns:
      Returns true if there is a piece at the given spot, otherwise false

    • isOpponentPiece

      public boolean isOpponentPiece(int row, int col, ChessPiece[][] board)
      Checks ot see if the given square is an opponent piece
      Parameters:
      row - the row the piece is being moved to
      col - the column the piece is being moved to
      board - the current board containing all the pieces on it
      Returns:
      returns true is the given coord has an opponent's piece, false otherwise

    • canCapturePiece

      public abstract boolean canCapturePiece(int toRow, int toCol, ChessPiece[][] board)
      Checks to see if the current chess piece can capture the piece at the given square
      Parameters:
      toRow - the row the piece is being moved to, to capture the opponent piece
      toCol - the column the piece is being moved to, to capture the opponent piece
      Returns:
      Returns if the current chess piece can capture the piece on the given coords

    • getSymbol

      public abstract String getSymbol()
      Gets the string representation of the piece that the player utilizes when executing moves.
      Returns:
      Returns the indicator of the chess piece which can be mapped to its position on the chess board
